TopicTitle: I mix up the real solar system and KSP's solar system far too often

Articles.Content:
Recently I've begun to catch myself mixing up the real solar system and that of KSP a lot. The other day I had to write down the list of planets for a project and went: "Mercury, Venus, Earth, Du..." And today I was dealing with some Venus stuff and thought to myself: "Why didn't Mariner visit Venus's moon?"

Anyone else catching themselves doing the same?
Note quite, but I have been thinking of the gas in my car in terms of delta-v budget. And when I need to brake, I think "N key" sometimes.

Recently I've begun to catch myself mixing up the real solar system and that of KSP a lot. The other day I had to write down the list of planets for a project and went: "Mercury, Venus, Earth, Du..." And today I was dealing with some Venus stuff and thought to myself: "Why didn't Mariner visit Venus's moon?"

Anyone else catching themselves doing the same?

I looked up last night and saw Jool was quite close to the Mun.
I was talking about Earth and ALMOST accedently said kerbin >.>
I do to sometimes, once i was talking to a friend about curiosity and i started to say 'Duna" one sentence but i caught myself right after the "du".
My 4-year old son has asked me where you can find Jool in the night sky before. He also wonders when the developers are going to add Arde and Binbin to the game still.
During lunch break, me and my friend got into a debate about colonizing Venuses moon. And then, someone pointed out that Venus didn't have a moon.

I know when I am recording videos I catch myself saying the Earth instead of Kerbin a lot of the time. I know some might also say that using the term sun to describe Kerbol is wrong, but to me if it is what helps produce like on the planet that is a sun in my eyes.

I know when I am recording videos I catch myself saying the Earth instead of Kerbin a lot of the time. I know some might also say that using the term sun to describe Kerbol is wrong, but to me if it is what helps produce like on the planet that is a sun in my eyes.

Well, the science archive page says Sun, so I guess the devs might be wrong.
I have argued many times that minmus is real, and put the KSP planets on my science test
I confuse Duna and Mars a lot.

yeah I do this quite a bit. I often look up at Mun when I'm walking home at night and the boundaries between Kerbin and Earth have blurred quite badly. It's also made me think that "Earth" and "The Moon" are really not very good names.
Everytime I enter a flying vehicle in a video game, I press the T key.

Well, the science archive page says Sun, so I guess the devs might be wrong.

It's called the Sun in game, and it always has been. Nowhere in the game (check the tracking station) is it called the Sun. The devs aren't wrong, everyone else is.

Well, the science archive page says Sun, so I guess the devs might be wrong.

No, the devs call it the sun. It's the comunity that nicknamed it Kerbol

No, the devs call it the sun. It's the comunity that nicknamed it Kerbol

Which is probably appropriate. We don't call our sun Sol unless we're referring to the whole star system. Our star is the Sun, but it's the center of the Sol System. So Kerbin's star is the Sun, but it's part of the Kerbol system. An outsider might call the star Kerbol, but the Kerbals wouldn't.

Which is probably appropriate. We don't call our sun Sol unless we're referring to the whole star system. Our star is the Sun, but it's the center of the Sol System. So Kerbin's star is the Sun, but it's part of the Kerbol system. An outsider might call the star Kerbol, but the Kerbals wouldn't.

That is a VERY good explanation. Nice
Yeah... then my friends look a me oddly, and I go, ehm, sorry, KSP, and they're like, *facepalm*.
Moho has taken over Mercury in my brain. I have to think for a minute before saying mercury.
During the Chang'e3 landing the other day, I may have almost tweeted about how "China is landing a rover on the Mun."
I've confused the Mun and the moon so many times. It's pretty embarrassing.

Note quite, but I have been thinking of the gas in my car in terms of delta-v budget. And when I need to brake, I think "N key" sometimes.

Yeah. I think of it not as braking but burning retrograde.

And every time I come to a roundabout (US: traffic circle?) I'm thinking of SOI and escape velocity and wondering whether I could use a maneuver node.

While I was discussing human expansion into outer space with my sister I brought up that after the Moon colonising Minmus would be the next logical step. I corrected myself half a second later to much laughter.

Yeah. I think of it not as braking but burning retrograde.

And every time I come to a roundabout (US: traffic circle?) I'm thinking of SOI and escape velocity and wondering whether I could use a maneuver node.

As long as you dont take your foot completly off the gas, cause, you know, you are orbiting and all...

Just recently, i watched a car shooting out of a roundabout at 100m/s... nice slingshot-maneuver, i thought.

Edit: Thinking about it, there might be something to computer-controlled electro-magnetic (or alternatively remote-controlling cars directly) centres for roundabouts, after all... slowing entering cars down to a set max speed, pushing leaving cars out... maybe someday, we wil actually see such things...

Edited December 21, 2013 by Mr. Scruffy
